metadata.Title: CVE-2013-2119 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Phusion Passenger gem before 3.0.21 and 4.0.x before 4.0.5 for Ruby allowslocal users to cause a denial of service (prevent application start) orgain privileges by pre-creating a temporary "config" file in a directorywith a predictable name in /tmp/ before it is used by the gem.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2119` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-passenger - 4.0.37-2
ruby-passenger - 4.0.37-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby-passenger package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.37-2').
